definition[0]: an old-fashioned method of sending messages using radio or electrical signals
definition[1]: a piece of equipment that receives or sends messages in this way
definition[2]: to send a message by telegraph
example[0]: Once he knew where we were, Lewis telegraphed every few hours.
definition[3]: to let people know what you intend to do without saying anything
example[1]: A slight movement of the hand telegraphed his intention to shoot.
